title: Heft Plugin Configuration
description: Defines configuration used by core Heft.

parameterKind.title: Parameter Kind
parameterKind.description: Indicates the kind of syntax for this command-line parameter

longName.title: Long Name
longName.description: The name of the parameter (e.g. "--verbose").  This is a required field.

shortName.title: Short Name
shortName.description: A optional short form of the parameter (e.g. "-v" instead of "--verbose")

description.title: Parameter Description
description.description: A detailed description of the parameter, which appears when requesting help for the command (e.g. "heft phaseName --help my-command").

required.title: Required
required.description: If true, then this parameter must be included on the command line

choiceParameter.title: Choice Parameter
choiceParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose argument must be chosen from a list of allowable alternatives

alternatives.title: Alternatives
alternatives.description: A list of alternative argument values that can be chosen for this parameter.

name.title: Name of Alternative
name.description: A token that is one of the alternatives that can be used with the choice parameter, e.g. "vanilla" in "--flavor vanilla"

description.title: Description of Alternative
description.description: A detailed description for the alternative that will be shown in the command-line help.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: If the parameter is omitted from the command line, this value will be inserted by default

choiceListParameter.title: Choice List Parameter
choiceListParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose arguments must be chosen from a list of allowable alternatives

alternatives.title: Alternatives
alternatives.description: A list of alternative argument values that can be chosen for this parameter.

name.title: Name of Alternative
name.description: A token that is one of the alternatives that can be used with the choice parameter, e.g. "vanilla" in "--flavor vanilla"

description.title: Description of Alternative
description.description: A detailed description for the alternative that will be shown in the command-line help.

flagParameter.title: Flag Parameter
flagParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose presence acts as an on/off switch

integerParameter.title: Integer Parameter
integerParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as an integer

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: If the parameter is omitted from the command line, this value will be inserted by default

integerListParameter.title: Integer List Parameter
integerListParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a list of integers

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

stringParameter.title: String Parameter
stringParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a string

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: If the parameter is omitted from the command line, this value will be inserted by default

stringListParameter.title: String List Parameter
stringListParameter.description: A command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a string list

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

pluginName.title: Plugin Name
pluginName.description: Name of the plugin to load from the package.

entryPoint.title: Entry Point
entryPoint.description: The entry point path. This path is resolved relative to the package folder.

optionsSchema.title: Options Schema
optionsSchema.description: Path to the schema that defines the options for the plugin. This schema should be a valid JSON schema. This path is resolved relative to the package folder.

parameterScope.title: Parameter Scope
parameterScope.description: The scope of the parameters for the plugin. This scope is used to provide alternate names for parameters if there is a conflict between identical long names. For example, if scope "my-scope" is provided and parameter "--parameter" is defined, it may be referenced as "--parameter" or "--my-scope:parameter" on the CLI. When multiple "--parameter" parameters are defined with different scopes, they can only be referenced by their scoped long name. If no scope is provided, the scope will default to the plugin name.

$schema.description: Part of the JSON Schema standard, this optional keyword declares the URL of the schema that the file conforms to. Editors may download the schema and use it to perform syntax highlighting.

lifecyclePlugins.title: Lifecycle Plugins
lifecyclePlugins.description: A list of plugins that will be loaded and used for Heft lifecycle hooks.

taskPlugins.title: Task Plugins
taskPlugins.description: A list of plugins that will be loaded and used for Heft task hooks.
